revised_title: The Properties and Functions of Ascaris Lumbricoides Haemoglobins
tldr: The authors studied the properties and functions of the two distinct haemoglobins found in the parasitic nematode Ascaris lumbricoides. They confirmed the occurrence of haemoglobins in the perienteric fluid and body wall of the worms and determined their absorption spectra. Both haemoglobins exhibit a remarkable resistance to deoxygenation, which is due to a low deoxygenation velocity. The study provides insights into the metabolic processes and oxygen requirements of the parasitic nematodes.
